page.title: 19Ambulance Service, Bolton
page.content: {Bolton Ambulance Control}is a new control dealing with all ambulances from Manchester to Merseyside for a population of 1.5 million. There are {12 Ambulance Stations}taking in{Wigan, {Salford,& Bolton}with 51fully-equipped vehicles & 43 sitting-case vehicles.A mobile control is used for disasters like the one at Salford last year when a train was derailed. Most of the calls(about 1000 per day) are for{ {general cases}such as taking people to & from Hospitals for appointments.{ {Urgent calls}are for cases needing transport within a given time for hospital admission, usually requested by a doctor. About 100{Emergency 999} calls are received every day, and the time taken to get the ambulance there is approx. 6 minutes. Brian Walsh.
